title: Full Scottish hearing of Catalan extradition case due in July - lawyer
text:
April 12, 2018 / 10:58 AM / Updated 19 minutes ago Full Scottish hearing of Catalan extradition case due in July - lawyer Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
EDINBURGH (Reuters) - A full extradition hearing in the case of Catalan ex-minister Clara Ponsati, who is fighting attempts to return her to Spain from Scotland, will start on July 30 and last two weeks, her lawyer Aamer Anwar said on Thursday. Catalunya's former Education Minister Clara Ponsati and her lawyer Aamer Anwar leave court after a preliminary hearing was held for her extradition at the Sheriff Court in Edinburgh, Scotland, April 12, 2018. REUTERS/Russell Cheyne 
Ponsati, currently working as a professor at Scotlandâ€™s University of St Andrews, is one of several Catalan leaders being sought by the Spanish courts for their part in organising an independence referendum last year deemed illegal by the Spanish state. Reporting by Elisabeth O'Leary, editing by Stephen Addison
